description: The "Wild Numbers", from the novel of the same title (Version 1).
comments: Apparently these are completely fictional and there is no mathematical explanation. However, see the pseudo-wild numbers in A058971, A058972, A058973, A058977, A058988, A059175. See also the Lagarias article.
references: P. Schogt, De Wilde Getallen, De Arbeiderspers, Amsterdam, 1998.
P. Schogt, The Wild Numbers, Four Walls Eight Windows Pub., New York, 2000.
D. F. Wallace, Rhetoric and the math melodrama, Science, 290 (Dec 22 2000), 2263-2267.
A number of other reviews of this book exist on the Web.
links: J. C. Lagarias, Wild and Wooley numbers, Amer. Math. Monthly, 113 (No. 2, 2006), 97-108.
Christian Perfect, Integer sequence reviews on Numberphile (or vice versa), 2013.
P. Schogt, The Wild Number Problem: math or fiction?, arXiv:1211.6583 [math.HO], 2012. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 03 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 08 2001
extensions: Thanks to _Enoch Haga_ for investigating these numbers (Jan 14 2001).
